title: First Vision
description: Joseph Smith reports his First Vision, where he claims to have seen God the Father and Jesus Christ.

title: Organization of the Church
description: Joseph Smith officially organizes the Church of Christ, later known as The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

title: Kirtland Temple Dedication
description: The first temple of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints is dedicated in Kirtland, Ohio.

title: Expulsion from Missouri
description: Mormon settlers are expelled from Missouri due to the Missouri Executive Order 44, also known as the 'Extermination Order.'

title: Martyrdom of Joseph Smith
description: Joseph Smith and his brother Hyrum Smith are killed by a mob in Carthage, Illinois.

title: Nauvoo Exodus
description: The Mormon pioneers begin their exodus from Nauvoo, Illinois, heading west to find a new home.

title: Winter Quarters
description: Mormon pioneers establish Winter Quarters as a temporary settlement near Omaha, Nebraska.

title: Brigham Young Leads Pioneer Company
description: Brigham Young leads the first pioneer company, known as the vanguard company, to the Salt Lake Valley.

title: Pioneers Enter Salt Lake Valley
description: The first Mormon pioneers enter the Salt Lake Valley, establishing a new home for the Church.

title: Handcart Companies
description: Several groups of Mormon pioneers travel to the Salt Lake Valley using handcarts, facing significant hardships along the way.

title: Utah War
description: A confrontation between Mormon settlers in Utah Territory and the United States government, resolved without significant bloodshed.
